required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy of CVC Depth Prediction in Internal Jugular Veins: The Difference Between The Andropoulos and ECG Methods
clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy of CVC Depth Prediction in Internal Jugular Veins: The Difference Between The Andropoulos and ECG Methods

brief_summary.textblock: compare the accuracy of CVC depth prediction in internal jugular veins: the difference between the andropoulos and ECG methods

detailed_description.textblock: seventy two subjects were given informed consent before the study started. compare the accuracy of CVC depth prediction in internal jugular veins with two difference methods, the andropoulos method and ECG method.

primary_outcome.measure: CVC prediction depth using andropulous equation
primary_outcome.description: CVC will be inserted in certain depth according to the calculated depth

secondary_outcome.description: changes in p wave during CVC insertion

arm_group.description: Andropulous method uses equations to determine the depth of CVC insertion. For subject with <100 cm in height: Depth of CVC insertion (cm) = (height (cm)/ 10)-1 For subject with >100 cm in height: Depth of CVC insertion (cm) = (height (cm)/ 10)-2
change in p wave from ECG

intervention.description: Counts the CVC depth using specific equation
Using ECG to monitor the insertion of the CVC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- signing informed consent form
- indicated for CVC insertion
- has no contraindication for right internal jugular vein CVC insertion
Exclusion Criteria:
- has history of arrhythmia
- has cardiac malformation history
